passage: Scientists previously thought that all electric eels belong to a single species , but a team of researchers led by zoologist C. David de Santana proved this idea wrong by ______ blank that there are in fact three distinct species of electric eels.
question_text: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

answer_rationales.D: Choice D is the best answer. "Demonstrating" means "showing," and the text describes how de Santana disproved a previous belief in only one species of electric eel by showing that three electric eel species actually exist.
answer_rationales.A: Choice A is incorrect. Pretending that there are three species of electric eel might be a fun game for marine biologists, but it wouldn't prove the existence of more than one species.
answer_rationales.B: Choice B is incorrect. Complaining won't prove anything about eels, so de Santana could not have proved wrong the idea of only one species of electric eel by complaining about it.
answer_rationales.C: Choice C is incorrect. "Requiring" means "needing." It wouldn't make sense to say that de Santana "needed" there to be three distinct species of electric eel.
